job_details.Functieomschrijving:
The Customer Contact Analytics (CCA) Team is responsible for generating continuous insights of KPN's business operations. We achieve this by collecting customer contact events across multiple channels, and processing/analysing them using various techniques (incl. but not limited to AI, GenAI, ML, and NLP). Our application is used by several hundreds of internal users, generating business value in the millions per year. The team is currently composed of a Product Owner and 3 Data Scientists, supported by external ML Engineers. In order to accelerate CCA's performance to near-real time, we are looking for talented Software/Data Engineers.

    Responsibilities:

   * Redesign and optimize our Kafka streaming components to reduce latency, increase throughput, and increase event consumption rate.

   * Upgrading/Developing new components of a multilayered application to enable near real-time data processing.

   * Monitor, maintain and debug all components daily to ensure stability and consistency.
job_details.full_text:
Data engineer

The Customer Contact Analytics (CCA) Team is responsible for generating continuous insights of KPN's business operations. We achieve this by collecting customer contact events across multiple channels, and processing/analysing them using various techniques (incl. but not limited to AI, GenAI, ML, and NLP). Our application is used by several hundreds of internal users, generating business value in the millions per year. The team is currently composed of a Product Owner and 3 Data Scientists, supported by external ML Engineers. In order to accelerate CCA's performance to near-real time, we are looking for talented Software/Data Engineers.

    Responsibilities:

   * Redesign and optimize our Kafka streaming components to reduce latency, increase throughput, and increase event consumption rate.

   * Upgrading/Developing new components of a multilayered application to enable near real-time data processing.

   * Monitor, maintain and debug all components daily to ensure stability and consistency.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on data engineering tasks like optimizing Kafka streams and developing data processing components, with a mention of AI/GenAI/ML/NLP as techniques used by the team, but not as core responsibilities for this role. The primary focus is on data infrastructure and processing rather than building or deploying AI models.

phrases: Redesign and optimize our Kafka streaming components to reduce latency, increase throughput, and increase event consumption rate.
Upgrading/Developing new components of a multilayered application to enable near real-time data processing.
job_tasks.justification: These phrases directly describe the design, optimization, and development of data pipelines and infrastructure, specifically mentioning Kafka streaming components and real-time data processing, which are core to data engineering.

phrases: Monitor, maintain and debug all components daily to ensure stability and consistency.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the operational aspects of ensuring the stability, consistency, and maintenance of data processing components, which aligns with the operational responsibilities in MLOps, albeit in a data engineering context.

phrases: Redesign and optimize our Kafka streaming components to reduce latency, increase throughput, and increase event consumption rate.
Monitor, maintain and debug all components daily to ensure stability and consistency.
soft_skills.justification: The tasks of redesigning, optimizing, and debugging components to improve performance and ensure stability require strong problem-solving and a pragmatic, results-oriented approach.

phrases: processing/analysing them using various techniques (incl. but not limited to AI, GenAI, ML, and NLP).
soft_skills.justification: The mention of various techniques including AI, GenAI, ML, and NLP suggests a need for the engineer to be adaptable and willing to learn or work with these evolving technologies, even if not directly developing them.
